caption:
This photograph depicts an interesting scene at an old, dilapidated stone building that appears to be the ruins of a large structure with multiple floors, as evidenced by the remaining stone walls and window frames. The building is surrounded by lush vegetation, indicating that it has been abandoned for quite some time and nature has begun to reclaim the area.

In the foreground, there are two individuals, one girl and one boy, exploring the ruins. The girl, wearing a pink shirt and dark shorts, is stepping carefully on uneven ground covered with stones and debris. The boy, wearing a light-colored shirt and dark shorts, is slightly ahead of her and appears to be climbing or stepping down from a raised surface, probably navigating through the rocky terrain. 

The environment around them is overgrown, with shrubs, grass, and small trees sprouting between the rocks and rubble. The scene is open to the sky, suggesting that parts of the building's roof have collapsed over time.

The overall composition captures a moment of exploration and curiosity amidst the backdrop of historical decay, emphasizing themes of adventure and the passage of time.
title: Young vacationers explore the ruins of the r.m.  Snyder mansion, one of the landmarks of the ha ha tonka area of the lake of the ozarks.  The mansion, built by scottish masons and resembling a scottish castle, burned in 1942
placename: Ozarks, Lake of the, State Park (Mo.)
location: Ozarks, Lake of the, State Park, Missouri
